item.title: [Galkons/Renamed]100% Ancient Curses Interface
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

K4rn4ge:

^Send me in a PM of what you changed

Nah, i just meant that i had never really thought about doing it like you do in this interface

K4rn4ge:

setBounds(22568, 5, 120, index, Interface); index++;

It will come in handy doing that in the future because i hate having to rename around 80 child id’s or something just to correctly add a sprite.

Read full topic

item.title: [Galkons/Renamed]100% Ancient Curses Interface
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[quote=“K4rn4ge, post:11, topic:341596”]@Phaze One, in my client i already had a .type == 8 for another interface(think my bank), and any time i tried doing tooltips with these it would crash, so i just changed the .type == 8 to .type == 9. Get what im saying?

@glestrts, Lol thanks, its not really that hard you just gotta change one thing lol :P[/quote]
I know, found it while reading through the interface, i had never though about using index++ to raise the child id’s.

Read full topic

item.title: [Galkons/Renamed]100% Ancient Curses Interface
item.dc:creator: @K4rn4ge K4rn4ge
item.description:
@K4rn4ge wrote:

@Phaze One, in my client i already had a .type == 8 for another interface(think my bank), and any time i tried doing tooltips with these it would crash, so i just changed the .type == 8 to .type == 9. Get what im saying?

@glestrts, Lol thanks, its not really that hard you just gotta change one thing lol

I found the slightest error btw. This:

else if (class9_1.type == 7)

Needs to be this:

Only the slightest mistake. Btw, any hints on the anti leech?
